alert.note: Alert for Coke; Coleman; Concho; Nolan; Runnels; Taylor; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 1:17AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Coke, west central Coleman, southern Nolan, northeastern Tom Green, western Taylor, Runnels and northwestern Concho Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 116 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Oak Creek Reservoir, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ballinger, Winters, Robert Lee, Blackwell, Maverick, Nolan, Bronte, Miles, Maryneal, Lowake, Glen Cove, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Bradshaw, Hatchel, Sanco, Rowena, Hylton, Orient, Norton and Benoit. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coke; Coleman; Concho; Nolan; Runnels; Taylor; Tom Green
